Title: IAEA Completes International Physical Protection Advisory Service...
Description: An IAEA team of experts completed an International Physical Protection Advisory Service mission in Romania.The ten-person team evaluated the country’s nuclear security regime for nuclear material and nuclear facilities.

Title: IAEA Task Force Confirms Japan's ALPS Treated Water Release Conti...
Description: The discharge of the ALPS treated water from Japan's Fukushima Daiichi Nuclear Power Station (FDNPS) is progressing in line with international safety standards, the Task Force set up by the IAEA confirmed this week following its latest four-day mission to Japan.

Title: Update 265 – IAEA Director General Statement on Situation in Ukra...
Description: The International Atomic Energy Agency (IAEA) remains committed to maintaining a presence at Ukraine’s Zaporizhzhya Nuclear Power Plant (ZNPP) to help prevent a nuclear accident during the military conflict, despite this week’s drone attack on one of its armoured vehicles during a regular rotation of IAEA teams stationed at the site, Director General Rafael Mariano Grossi said today.

Title: Discovery Channel to Launch Educational Series on Nuclear Science...
Description: The Discovery Channel is to air a series of short films about nuclear science and technology, made together with the IAEA, as part of a new strategic partnership to educate the public on nuclear-based solutions to global issues.

Title: IAEA Director General Calls for Diplomacy and Dialogue to Reduce ...
Description: IAEA Director General Rafael Mariano Grossi delivered the keynote address at the Nobel Peace Prize Forum 2024, calling for diplomacy and dialogue to reduce nuclear tensions and prevent proliferation.

Title: IAEA Director General's Speech at the Nobel Peace Prize Forum
Description: The IAEA Director General Rafael Mariano Grossi today delivered the keynote address at the Nobel Peace Prize Forum 2024: Nobel’s spotlight on our perilous path and how we change course.

Title: Update 264 – IAEA Director General Statement on Situation in Ukra...
Description: A drone hit and severely damaged an official vehicle of the International Atomic Energy Agency during a rotation today of IAEA teams to Ukraine’s Zaporizhzhya Nuclear Power Plant (ZNPP), in what Director General Rafael Mariano Grossi condemned as an 'unacceptable' attack on Agency staff working to prevent a nuclear accident during the military conflict.

Title: Indonesia Launches New National Cancer Control Plan Building on R...
Description: Indonesia has used conclusions and recommendations gathered during two recent IAEA missions to inform the development of its new National Cancer Control Plan.

Title: Dominican Republic Successfully Eradicate Mediterranean Fruit Fly...
Description: In record time, the Dominican Republic was able to successfully contain a new incursion of the Mediterranean fruit fly, a highly destructive pest threatening agricultural production worldwide in 2024.

Title: IAEA Reviews Progress of the Philippines' Nuclear Infrastructure ...
Description: As the Philippines embarks on the development of the country’s nuclear power programme, it is making progress in developing the necessary nuclear infrastructure, according to an IAEA review mission that concluded today.

Title: Update 263 – IAEA Director General Statement on Situation in Ukra...
Description: Ukraine’s three operating NPPs have largely restored their electricity production after sharply reducing output last week as a precautionary step due to renewed attacks on the country’s increasingly fragile energy grid, Director General Rafael Mariano Grossi of the IAEA said today.

Title: IAEA Building 'Strong Cooperation' with Uzbekistan in Nuclear Ene...
Description: The IAEA Director General has been in Uzbekistan this week as part of ongoing support to the country’s plans to harness nuclear science for its development, including through SMRs and a new cancer hospital.

Title: IAEA Mission Finds Ghana Committed to Nuclear and Radiation Safet...
Description: An International Atomic Energy Agency (IAEA) team of experts has commended Ghana for its commitment to the continuous improvement of nuclear and radiation safety as the country advances its plans to develop a nuclear power programme.

Title: What is Soil Erosion? How Can Nuclear Techniques Help to Identify...
Description: Soil erosion, the most common type of land degradation is a process that removes the upper layer of soil, from which plants get most of their nutrients and water.

Title: IAEA Profile: Harnessing Technology to Build Connections and Prot...
Description: I was fascinated by the idea that someone on one side of the world could communicate with someone on the other side because of technology. It really spoke to me,' says Rutendo Zvirawa, reflecting on what inspired her to pursue information technology.

Title: Bolivia to Strengthen Cancer Control Systems Based on Review Miss...
Description: Bolivia has taken a critical step towards strengthening its cancer control system by hosting an imPACT Review mission led by the IAEA, the World Health Organization (WHO), and the International Agency for Research on Cancer (IARC).

Title: IAEA Mission Says Bulgaria is Committed to a High Level of Nuclea...
Description: An International Atomic Energy Agency (IAEA) team of experts said Bulgaria has a comprehensive and robust regulatory framework for nuclear and radiation safety covering all facilities and activities.

Title: IAEA Completes International Physical Protection Advisory Service...
Description: An IAEA team of experts has concluded an International Physical Protection Advisory Service mission in Zimbabwe. The mission, conducted at the request of the Government of Zimbabwe, took place from 18 November to 29 November 2024.
